intro: Tarenna unioensis, commonly known as the slender tarenna, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, opposite leaves. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow, with four petals, and it produces small, dark blue berries. Tarenna unioensis is often found in humid, shaded environments within the rainforests of Madagascar.
